comments: Also largest prime factor of any composite <= n. E.g., a(15) = 7 since 7 is the largest prime factor of {4,6,8,9,10,12,14,15}, the composites <= 15.Also largest prime dividing A025527(n) = n!/LCM[1,..,n]. [Comment from _Ray Chandler_, Apr 26 2007: Primes > n/2 don't appear as factors of A025507(n) since they appear once in n! and again in the denominator LCM[1,...,n]. Primes <= n/2 appear more times in the numerator than the denominator so they appear in the fraction.]
formula: a(n) = Max(gpf((n+2) mod k): 1<k<(n+2) and k not prime), with gpf=A006530 (greatest prime factor). - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Mar 27 2004
author: _Labos Elemer_, Jun 22 2000; _David W. Wilson_, Jun 10 2005
extensions: More terms from _James A. Sellers_, Jul 04 2000
Edited by _N. J. A. Sloane_ at the suggestion of _Andrew Plewe_, May 14 2007
